definition: to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
to fit/balanced/suitable
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually

sentences.english: You wonder at the miracle of this awesome display of Nature.
sentences.chinese: 你對自然的這個令人敬畏的展示奇蹟嘖嘖稱奇。

sentences.english: It's hard to say "gee whiz" anymore.
At age 12, he stood here in Zhaolin Park and marveled at an ice replica of the Yellow Crane Tower, an ancient pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 12歲時，他曾對兆麟公園的冰雕黃鶴樓嘖嘖稱奇。

sentences.english: The dunes are among the highest in the world and they are spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 這是世界上最高的沙漠，令人嘖嘖稱奇。

to envy/to admire

the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
out of the ordinary
stupefied/flabbergasted

hard to believe/incredible
